column2: He found the ravine deserted.
column3: He found the ravine deserted.

column2: Growing more alarmed every minute, he began to retrace his steps. Then it was he encountered the two Swine-men I had seen dancing on the night of my arrival; blood-stained they were about the mouth, and intensely excited.
column3: Growing more alarmed every minute, he began to retrace his steps. Then it was he encountered the two Swine men I had seen dancing on the night of my arrival; blood stained they were about the mouth, and intensely excited.

column2: They came crashing through the ferns, and stopped with fierce faces when they saw him.
column3: They came crashing through the ferns, and stopped with fierce faces when they saw him.

column2: He cracked his whip in some trepidation, and forthwith they rushed at him.
column3: He cracked his whip in some trepidation, and forthwith they rushed at him.

column2: Never before had a Beast Man dared to do that.
column3: Never before had a Beast Man dared to do that.

column2: One he shot through the head; M'ling flung himself upon the other, and the two rolled grappling. M'ling got his brute under and with his teeth in its throat, and Montgomery shot that too as it struggled in M'ling's grip. He had some difficulty in inducing M'ling to come on with him. Thence they had hurried back to me.
column3: One he shot through the head; M'ling flung himself upon the other, and the two rolled grappling. column2: On the way, M'ling had suddenly rushed into a thicket and driven out an under-sized Ocelot-man, also blood-stained, and lame through a wound in the foot. This brute had run a little way and then turned savagely at bay, and Montgomery--with a certain wantonness, I thought--had shot him.

column2: What does it all mean? said I.

column2: He shook his head, and turned once more to the brandy.
column3: He shook his head, and turned once more to the brandy.

column2: XVIII.
column3: eighteen.

column2: THE FINDING OF MOREAU.
column3: THE FINDING OF MOREAU.

column2: WHEN I saw Montgomery swallow a third dose of brandy, I took it upon myself to interfere.
column3: WHEN I saw Montgomery swallow a third dose of brandy, I took it upon myself to interfere.

column2: He was already more than half fuddled. I told him that some serious thing must have happened to Moreau by this time, or he would have returned before this, and that it behoved us to ascertain what that catastrophe was. Montgomery raised some feeble objections, and at last agreed. We had some food, and then all three of us started.
column3: He was already more than half fuddled. I told him that some serious thing must have happened to Moreau by this time, or he would have returned before this, and that it behoved us to ascertain what that catastrophe was. Montgomery raised some feeble objections, and at last agreed. We had some food, and then all three of us started.

column2: It is possibly due to the tension of my mind, at the time, but even now that start into the hot stillness of the tropical afternoon is a singularly vivid impression.
column3: It is possibly due to the tension of my mind, at the time, but even now that start into the hot stillness of the tropical afternoon is a singularly vivid impression.

column2: M'ling went first, his shoulder hunched, his strange black head moving with quick starts as he peered first on this side of the way and then on that. He was unarmed; his axe he had dropped when he encountered the Swine-man.
column3: M'ling went first, his shoulder hunched, his strange black head moving with quick starts as he peered first on this side of the way and then on that. He was unarmed; his axe he had dropped when he encountered the Swine man.

column2: Teeth were _his_ weapons, when it came to fighting. Montgomery followed with stumbling footsteps, his hands in his pockets, his face downcast; he was in a state of muddled sullenness with me on account of the brandy.
column3: Teeth were underscore his underscore weapons, when it came to fighting. Montgomery followed with stumbling footsteps, his hands in his pockets, his face downcast; he was in a state of muddled sullenness with me on account of the brandy.

column2: My left arm was in a sling (it was lucky it was my left), and I carried my revolver in my right. Soon we traced a narrow path through the wild luxuriance of the island, going northwestward; and presently M'ling stopped, and became rigid with watchfulness.
column3: My left arm was in a sling (it was lucky it was my left), and I carried my revolver in my right. Soon we traced a narrow path through the wild luxuriance of the island, going northwestward; and presently M'ling stopped, and became rigid with watchfulness.

column2: Montgomery almost staggered into him, and then stopped too.
column3: Montgomery almost staggered into him, and then stopped too.

column2: Then, listening intently, we heard coming through the trees the sound of voices and footsteps approaching us.
column3: Then, listening intently, we heard coming through the trees the sound of voices and footsteps approaching us.

column2: He is dead, said a deep, vibrating voice.
column3: He is dead, said a deep, vibrating voice.

column2: He is not dead; he is not dead, jabbered another.
column3: He is not dead; he is not dead, jabbered another.

column2: We saw, we saw, said several voices.
column3: We saw, we saw, said several voices.

column2: Hullo! suddenly shouted Montgomery, "Hullo, there!"
column3: Hullo! suddenly shouted Montgomery, "Hullo, there!"

column2: Confound you! said I, and gripped my pistol.
column3: Confound you! said I, and gripped my pistol.

column2: There was a silence, then a crashing among the interlacing vegetation, first here, then there, and then half-a-dozen faces appeared,--strange faces, lit by a strange light.
column3: There was a silence, then a crashing among the interlacing vegetation, first here, then there, and then half a dozen faces appeared,--strange faces, lit by a strange light.

column2: M'ling made a growling noise in his throat.
column3: M'ling made a growling noise in his throat.

column2: I recognised the Ape-man: I had indeed already identified his voice, and two of the white-swathed brown-featured creatures I had seen in Montgomery's boat. With these were the two dappled brutes and that grey, horribly crooked creature who said the Law, with grey hair streaming down its cheeks, heavy grey eyebrows, and grey locks pouring off from a central parting upon its sloping forehead,--a heavy, faceless thing, with strange red eyes, looking at us curiously from amidst the green.
column3: I recognised the Ape man: I had indeed already identified his voice, and two of the white swathed brown featured creatures I had seen in Montgomery's boat. With these were the two dappled brutes and that grey, horribly crooked creature who said the Law, with grey hair streaming down its cheeks, heavy grey eyebrows, and grey locks pouring off from a central parting upon its sloping forehead,--a heavy, faceless thing, with strange red eyes, looking at us curiously from amidst the green.

column2: For a space no one spoke.
column3: For a space no one spoke.

column2: Then Montgomery hiccoughed, "Who--said he was dead?"
column3: Then Montgomery hiccoughed, "Who-said he was dead?"

column2: The Monkey-man looked guiltily at the hairy-grey Thing.

column2: He is dead, said this monster.
column3: He is dead, said this monster.

column2: There was nothing threatening about this detachment, at any rate. They seemed awestricken and puzzled.
column3: There was nothing threatening about this detachment, at any rate. They seemed awestricken and puzzled.

column2: Where is he? said Montgomery.
column3: Where is he? said Montgomery.

column2: Is there a Law now? asked the Monkey-man.
column3: Is there a Law now? asked the Monkey man.

column2: Is he dead indeed?"
column3: Is he dead indeed?"

column2: Is there a Law? repeated the man in white.
column3: Is there a Law? repeated the man in white.

column2: Is there a Law, thou Other with the Whip?
column3: Is there a Law, thou Other with the Whip?

column2: He is dead, said the hairy-grey Thing.
column3: He is dead, said the hairy grey Thing.

column2: And they all stood watching us.

column2: Prendick, said Montgomery, turning his dull eyes to me. "He's dead, evidently."
column3: Prendick, said Montgomery, turning his dull eyes to me. "He's dead, evidently."

column2: I had been standing behind him during this colloquy. I began to see how things lay with them.
column3: I had been standing behind him during this colloquy. I began to see how things lay with them.

column2: I suddenly stepped in front of Montgomery and lifted up my voice:--"Children of the Law," I said, "he is _not_ dead!" M'ling turned his sharp eyes on me. "He has changed his shape; he has changed his body," I went on. "For a time you will not see him.
column3: I suddenly stepped in front of Montgomery and lifted up my voice:--"Children of the Law," I said, "he is underscore not underscore dead!" M'ling turned his sharp eyes on me. "He has changed his shape; he has changed his body," I went on. "For a time you will not see him.

column2: He is--there," I pointed upward, "where he can watch you.
column3: He is-there," I pointed upward, "where he can watch you.

column2: You cannot see him, but he can see you. Fear the Law!"
column3: You cannot see him, but he can see you. Fear the Law!"

column2: I looked at them squarely.
column3: I looked at them squarely.

column2: They flinched.
column3: They flinched.

column2: He is great, he is good, said the Ape-man, peering fearfully upward among the dense trees.
column3: He is great, he is good, said the Ape man, peering fearfully upward among the dense trees.

column2: And the other Thing? I demanded.
column3: And the other Thing? I demanded.

column2: The Thing that bled, and ran screaming and sobbing,--that is dead too, said the grey Thing, still regarding me.
column3: The Thing that bled, and ran screaming and sobbing,--that is dead too, said the grey Thing, still regarding me.

column2: That's well, grunted Montgomery.

column2: But Montgomery was still sober enough to understand my motive in denying Moreau's death.

column2: He is not dead, he said slowly, "not dead at all. No more dead than I am."
column3: He is not dead, he said slowly, "not dead at all. No more dead than I am."

column2: Some, said I, "have broken the Law: they will die.
column3: Some, said I, "have broken the Law: they will die.

column2: Some have died. Show us now where his old body lies,--the body he cast away because he had no more need of it."
column3: Some have died. Show us now where his old body lies,--the body he cast away because he had no more need of it."

column2: It is this way, Man who walked in the Sea, said the grey Thing.

column2: And with these six creatures guiding us, we went through the tumult of ferns and creepers and tree-stems towards the northwest. Then came a yelling, a crashing among the branches, and a little pink homunculus rushed by us shrieking.
column3: And with these six creatures guiding us, we went through the tumult of ferns and creepers and tree stems towards the northwest. Then came a yelling, a crashing among the branches, and a little pink homunculus rushed by us shrieking.

column2: Immediately after appeared a monster in headlong pursuit, blood-bedabbled, who was amongst us almost before he could stop his career.
column3: Immediately after appeared a monster in headlong pursuit, blood bedabbled, who was amongst us almost before he could stop his career.

column2: The grey Thing leapt aside. M'ling, with a snarl, flew at it, and was struck aside.
column3: The grey Thing leapt aside. M'ling, with a snarl, flew at it, and was struck aside.

column2: Montgomery fired and missed, bowed his head, threw up his arm, and turned to run. I fired, and the Thing still came on; fired again, point-blank, into its ugly face.
column3: Montgomery fired and missed, bowed his head, threw up his arm, and turned to run. I fired, and the Thing still came on; fired again, point blank, into its ugly face.

column2: I saw its features vanish in a flash: its face was driven in.
column3: I saw its features vanish in a flash: its face was driven in.

column2: Yet it passed me, gripped Montgomery, and holding him, fell headlong beside him and pulled him sprawling upon itself in its death-agony.
column3: Yet it passed me, gripped Montgomery, and holding him, fell headlong beside him and pulled him sprawling upon itself in its death agony.

column2: I found myself alone with M'ling, the dead brute, and the prostrate man. Montgomery raised himself slowly and stared in a muddled way at the shattered Beast Man beside him.
column3: I found myself alone with M'ling, the dead brute, and the prostrate man. Montgomery raised himself slowly and stared in a muddled way at the shattered Beast Man beside him.

column2: It more than half sobered him. He scrambled to his feet.

column2: Then I saw the grey Thing returning cautiously through the trees.
column3: Then I saw the grey Thing returning cautiously through the trees.

column2: See, said I, pointing to the dead brute, "is the Law not alive? This came of breaking the Law."
column3: See, said I, pointing to the dead brute, "is the Law not alive? This came of breaking the Law."

column2: He peered at the body.
column3: He peered at the body.

column2: He sends the Fire that kills, said he, in his deep voice, repeating part of the Ritual. The others gathered round and stared for a space.
column3: He sends the Fire that kills, said he, in his deep voice, repeating part of the Ritual. The others gathered round and stared for a space.

column2: At last we drew near the westward extremity of the island. We came upon the gnawed and mutilated body of the puma, its shoulder-bone smashed by a bullet, and perhaps twenty yards farther found at last what we sought.
column3: At last we drew near the westward extremity of the island. We came upon the gnawed and mutilated body of the puma, its shoulder bone smashed by a bullet, and perhaps twenty yards farther found at last what we sought.

column2: Moreau lay face downward in a trampled space in a canebrake.
column3: Moreau lay face downward in a trampled space in a canebrake.

column2: One hand was almost severed at the wrist and his silvery hair was dabbled in blood. His head had been battered in by the fetters of the puma. The broken canes beneath him were smeared with blood. His revolver we could not find.
column3: One hand was almost severed at the wrist and his silvery hair was dabbled in blood. His head had been battered in by the fetters of the puma. The broken canes beneath him were smeared with blood. His revolver we could not find.

column2: Montgomery turned him over. Resting at intervals, and with the help of the seven Beast People (for he was a heavy man), we carried Moreau back to the enclosure. The night was darkling.
column3: Montgomery turned him over. Resting at intervals, and with the help of the seven Beast People (for he was a heavy man), we carried Moreau back to the enclosure. The night was darkling.

column2: Twice we heard unseen creatures howling and shrieking past our little band, and once the little pink sloth-creature appeared and stared at us, and vanished again. But we were not attacked again.
column3: Twice we heard unseen creatures howling and shrieking past our little band, and once the little pink sloth creature appeared and stared at us, and vanished again. But we were not attacked again.

column2: At the gates of the enclosure our company of Beast People left us, M'ling going with the rest. We locked ourselves in, and then took Moreau's mangled body into the yard and laid it upon a pile of brushwood. Then we went into the laboratory and put an end to all we found living there.
column3: At the gates of the enclosure our company of Beast People left us, M'ling going with the rest. We locked ourselves in, and then took Moreau's mangled body into the yard and laid it upon a pile of brushwood. Then we went into the laboratory and put an end to all we found living there.
